Mohamad El-Husseini Part-time hero, full-time superstar.

Hi, I'm Mohamad

I’m a part-time hero, full-time superstar dad, lifelong student, and a developer living in São Paulo, Brazil. I am co-founder at Aerogami, a development studio, where I am building Maestru, a project management application for construction and construction management companies.

I’m originally from Baalbak, Lebanon, although when I lived there I did so in Beirut. When I was twelve years old I moved to London, England. I was born in Wari, Nigeria. I went to university and worked in Boston for a few years.

I love programming, and learning programming languages. I work mostly in Ruby, and Ruby on Rails, which means I work with SCSS, CoffeeScript, and JavaScript, as well as Redis and Postgresql. I’ve dabbled in C and Objective-C. I still dabble in Swift and Elixir. I worked for a few years in ColdFusion. I spend most of my days thinking about, designing, improving, and progamming Maestru, our product.

When I find some spare time I like to play football and read about science, especially astronomy and biology, and fiction. I’m a bit of a news junkie. Although these days much of my reading time is spent on technical material.

I like cooking, especially for other people. I make an excellent hummus, and, so I’ve been told, a great sfiha.

I love to travel. But hey, who doesn’t? I’ve been lucky to have done a lot of it in my life, but not nearly enough. Sometimes by choice, other times because it was best to.

Thanks for visiting, and I hope you found something useful while you were here.
